definition[0]: to fasten something, or to be fastened in a particular way
example[0]: a skirt which does up at the back
example[1]: Do up your coat or you’ll get cold.
definition[1]: to repair an old building or car, or to improve its appearance
example[2]: They did up an old cottage in the Scottish Highlands.
definition[2]: to decorate something in a particular way
example[3]: The apartment was done up in Viennese style.
definition[4]: to make yourself look neat and attractive
example[4]: Sue spent ages doing herself up.
